result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont A Joyner Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ozaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
To be paid jointly & severally.

The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Total court costs due during term of supervision.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Clerk emailed clerk CM to enter civil judgment, probation terminated. Clerk also notified Agent Russ that her memo did not come thru the efiling system and she needs to upload and send again.

11:15 AM Defendant Lamont A Joyner in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court/DA reviewed courtesy copy (received by email)of the memorandum received by Agent Russ. Atty. Sisley requests extension of probation. Court terminates probation ordering a civil judgment be entered.
Controller confirmed balance due with DOC Cashier, defendant owes $2,474.99 restitution and $969.02 costs. Defendant has not made a payment since 2018.
Probation review hearing on October 20, 2020 at 10:00 am. Copy of court notice emailed to DOC agent Russ. Copy of notice also mailed to defendant's address with UPPER included in the address.

On Court's directive

Forwarded to Sheriff's

Defendant contacted clerk, did not know he was required to appear in court on 10/5, previously he did not appear and probation was extended. He stated paperwork does not say he needs to appear but that probation will be extended. Defendant stated he is not working due to COVID. On Court's directive, Court will cancell warrant and schedule for a hearing. Defendant must appear on court date. Clerk contacted defendant who updated his address, he will appear in court on 10/20 at 10:00 am. Clerk emailed defendant's agent Russ that warrant will be cancelled, hearing scheduled on 10/20. She may submit a memo to the Court.
